title: Calories in a Bowl of Chili
meta_description: Discover calories in bowl chili, including macros like protein and carbs, per-serving breakdown, and easy tweaks for your recipe.
h1: Calories in a Bowl of Chili
assumptions: Standard homemade beef chili with beans, tomatoes, onions, and spices; ~250 g serving size; no added toppings like cheese or sour cream.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by recipe, meat type, bean variety, portion size, and cooking method. Check labels for canned or restaurant versions.

quick_answer.text: One bowl of beef chili provides ~350 kcal and ~20 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaged products.

tweaks.label: Vegetarian version (replace beef with more beans)

faqs.q: How many calories in bowl chili?
faqs.a: About 350 kcal for a standard 250 g bowl of beef chili with beans.

faqs.q: What's the protein in a bowl of chili?
faqs.a: Roughly 20 g protein from beef and beans.
Yes, around 800 mg per bowl due to seasonings and canned tomatoes/beans.

faqs.q: How do calories change for vegetarian chili?
faqs.a: Vegetarian versions are often lower, around 270 kcal per bowl.

faqs.q: What's the carb content in bowl chili?
faqs.a: About 30 g carbs, including 8 g fiber from beans and veggies.
